name: Hassayampa Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has an outstanding location with an abundance of on-street parking, and meals and service in the restaurant were great. Unfortunately, these were the best parts of our experience at the hotel - the following comments have nothing to do with the hotel being a historic landmark and therefore not "modern". Despite the fact that we were the only people in the lobby during check-in, our greeting from the front desk consisted of the young man asking for a driver's license and credit card after we gave him our name, then telling us that we could only use the elevator if one of the staff was available to operate it. Housekeeping was spotty and inconsistent: trash cans in the bedroom still contained items from the previous occupant, the corners of our shower and the track that guides the shower doors needed a good scrubbing with bleach and a brush to remove mold, and although our used bathroom glasses were removed by housekeeping each morning, for some reason we had to request replacements. And historic hotel or not, the bed situation was a mystery: at an average cost per night of $160 for 5 nights (not including meals), bed linens should be new and crisp, mattresses should replaced frequently enough so that they don't cause guests to roll to the center of the bed during the night, and pillows should be replaced when the filling starts to separate and bunch up. Unless you have to stay in the heart of downtown "Preskit", you might want to consider saving some $$ and stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: A great location, but .......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there over the 4th of July holiday. I loved the personable service from the staff from the moment we arrived. The front dest staff were playful and willing to jump in and help us with our luggage. Throughout our stay, the front desk staff were able to remember our names and use them to address us.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, fun and relaxing

reviews.text: We had a problem with our toilet, and from the time we told them of the problem, they had someone up in our room to replace the toilet within minutes. The whole process took an hour and they left the place very clean. It was no disturbance to us at all.
reviews.title: I'm in Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the courtyard music each night from 5-7pm. Nice jazz outside in the beautiful green courtyard. Drinks were available, too. From there we went to the dining room and enjoyed our dinner. Comfortable and tasty. Afterwards, we stopped in the bar where there was a different group playing jazz. We enjoyed ourselves there for a while as well.
reviews.title: Worst Value ever for a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the lobby and enjoyed people watching and relaxing there for a while, too. There was a piano there available for anyone who could play.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in a great little town

reviews.text: If you like the "unique" and love old hotels, then I really recommend and suggest the Hassayampa for its charm and the feel of the place. It is a historic hotel. Remember, this is not going to be something that blows you away with elegance. The rooms are small, like old hotels, they are tastefully decorated, but not fancy. The floors creak a little and it has a long history. It is beloved by locals, it is beloved by those who have stayed there for its charm and location, and it is still the site for many a local event. When I was there they were decorating the lobby in halloween spookinness for a local charity fundraiser. The night I joined them, the patio was filled with alums of the local Embry and Riddle flight school
reviews.title: An old Territorial Hotel...Charming..Perfect for those wishing to avoid a chain.

reviews.text: The restaurant and bar are really interesting and again historic.
reviews.title: The crown jewel of Prescott

reviews.text: I have stayed here twice and enjoyed it enough to stay again. Its even a little romantic with its charm. The bar is a little dead each time I came and the breakfast wasn't as good this time was it was the first time I visited. The rates are great.
reviews.title: A Trip Back in TIme.

reviews.text: Tips. First the location cant be beat. It is steps away from the Old Courthouse square and Whiskey Row. It is also about a 5-10 minute walk (through a lovely historic district) to Acker park where a system of well marked hiking trails give you a great walk or run overlooking the city.
reviews.title: Eat here.....everything was fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our arrival at the Hassayampa Inn was the culmination of a long day that included a book signing at the Barnes & Noble store in Flagstaff, almost three hundred miles of driving, and a torrential storm. The friendly and professional staff as well as the attention to detail in the preservation and restoration of this property as evidenced by the lobby were a breath of fresh air.
reviews.title: HASSAYAMPA INN FOUR STAR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My email to the manager:
reviews.title: Thanks For The Memory

reviews.text: Marian K. and I would like to thank you and your good humored staff for a delightful stay at your marvelous hotel. The staff was exceptionally attentive. Linda cheerfully expedited our check-in upon arrival, and Greg jumped to our every need. Zac patiently helped us learn to pronounce Hassayampa, and smoothed the arrangements for our second night's stay on the busy evening preceding John McCain's campaign address on the courthouse steps.
reviews.title: Historic

reviews.text: The accommodations were comfortable and well maintained, and there was none of the odor from cleaning products that plagues other hotels. We appreciated the fresh fruit, coffee service, and newspapers provided in the lounge while we awaited seating for breakfast. We apologize for not taking the names of dining room hosts and servers, but the service, breakfast entrées, and sparkling table linens were exceptional.
reviews.title: Sweet building but noisy!!!

likes.liked: — It's a beautiful and historic structure.

reviews.title: A treasure to enjoy anytime of the year
reviews.text: We love the historic downtown location and will happy refer everyone we know to be visiting the area to stay at your Inn.

reviews.title: An Excellent Place to Dine in Prescott, Arizona
reviews.text: At first sight, the hotel is eye catching with it's red brick walls. The entry is pretty with it's fountain, benches and potted flowers. The lobby was gorgeous, and well cared for. The entire "public" area of the hotel was immaculate.

This hotel was a VERY pleasant surprise!! I went to Prescott to do a lecture and was told that the Hassayampa Inn was a centrally located hotel. It was much more than that. It was just beautiful. The integrity of this venerable old hotel was maintained and enhaced. The room was very comfortable. The real excellence of this hotel was the service and the food. Both were superior. The following day, I was in a resort hotel in Scottsdale. The service there was impeccable, but the staff at the Hassayampa Inn was every bit as solicitous. The breakfast was unbeatable as was the restaurant staff. Kudos to everyone working at this wonderful hotel..
reviews.title: Hassayampa Inn
What A Wonderful Time!!!
reviews.text: Lloyd Watnik

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Diego, CA
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay!!!

likes.disliked: — Nothing! The whole experience was epic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is loaded with charm and is located within walking distance to the town square & shopping. We found the food and service at The Peacock Dining Room to be fabulous! After dinner we visited the Lounge and heard some of the best jazz ever---and they were a local group! We were planning on leaving early on Sunday to head back home, but wound up staying until 9 pm, just to hang out and listen to the group again! We booked a package deal, which was extremely reasonable and included wine, dinner & breakfast for two. You will love this place!!!
reviews.title: The feel of yesterday

likes.liked: — Historic feel and the breakfast ever

reviews.text: While hunting for antique treasures along Cortez Street in downtown Prescott, my husband & I decided to stay overnight at this wonderful historic hotel. The customer service was overwhelming, and the Peacock Room just took us both back in time. When you do the math, the room rate included a full breakfast, you couldnt find better accomodations anywhere in town!
reviews.title: Loving life at the Hassayampa

likes.liked: — The staff, the history, the food

description: Known as the Grand Dame of Prescott, the Hassayampa Inn was built as a luxury Hotel in 1927 to entice Phoenix tourists to flee the summer heat. Nostalgic elegance with a restored 1920's style lobby, little has changed since the Inn first opened its doors 81 years ago, but every modern amenity you'd expect a 21st century hotel to offer, including high speed wireless internet. Enjoy world class cuisine in the ultra-fashionable, yet comfortable, Peacock Dining Room. Live jazz is frequent in the leisurely Cowboy Bar. Prescott's world-famous Courthouse square is a mere block away with endless boutiques and antique stores.
